meanings.definition: To cause a tingling or stinging sensation
meanings.sent1: The spicy food made my tongue prickling.
meanings.sent2: The cold wind prickling my skin.
meanings.sent3: The ticklish feather was prickling my nose.
meanings.sent4: Her words prickling my conscience like tiny needles.
meanings.sent5: The anticipation of the surprise gift was prickling my excitement.

meanings.sent1: The prickling in my fingers after holding ice.
meanings.sent2: The prickling of excitement before a roller coaster ride.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected compliment gave me a pleasant prickling.
meanings.sent4: The eerie silence sent a prickling down my spine.
meanings.sent5: The prickling of fear as the thunderstorm approached.

meanings.definition: Covered in small, sharp points or thorns
meanings.sent1: The prickling cactus in the desert.
meanings.sent2: The prickling hedgehog curled into a ball.
meanings.sent3: The prickling surface of the rough sandpaper.
meanings.sent4: The prickling sensation of walking on pine needles barefoot.
meanings.sent5: The prickling sensation of touching a porcupine's quills.
